column4: umm can anybody tell me the problem here, I need to find out why unity is not loading... here is the link: http://paste.ubuntu.com/956878/
did it work before?
Did unity ever work before?
It seems that your computer doesn't support unity. Use unity 2d.
At the login screen, change the session to unity 2d
or you can launch it from a command line with the command unity-2d --replace
then install with apt-get. sudo apt-get install unity-2d
Are you still there?
Install unity-2d with apt-get install unity-2d
are you root?
run apt-get install unity-2d-launcher unity-2d-panel unity-2d-places unity-2d-spread unity-2d
Try upgrading to ubuntu 11.10, it comes with unity 2d preinstalled.
I think you can upgrade from the command line with apt-get dist-upgrade
No, they can both be installed, it seems you have a strange system. Would you be willing to upgrade to 11.10?
Then upgrade to 11.10, which comes with unity-2d.
If you get 12.04 you get unity 2d.
Good luck!
unity uses a 3d redering engine whereas 2d doesn't, so yes.
your original dump said your graphics card wasn't good enough.
Unity 2d works on everything :)
Your welcome, and good luck!
It isn't usually all that safe to upgrade packages mannually, but I would say (I don't know apt-get very well) apt-get install libgcc
